qas.question: What  did paddle streamers serve until the 1960's

answers.text: the piers at Weston-super-Mare, Clevedon, Portishead and Minehead were served by the paddle steamers of P and A Campbell

qas.question: What was the pier on Burnham -on-sea used for

answers.text: The pier at Burnham-on-Sea was used for commercial goods

qas.question: What is the shortest pier in the UK

answers.text: The pier at Burnham-on-Sea is the shortest pier in the UK
In the 1970s the Royal Portbury Dock was constructed to provide extra capacity for the Port of Bristol

qas.question: What pier in Somerset could accommodate the biggest ships?
What were the piers at Barry primarily used for?
What is the longest pier in Somerset?
In what decade was the Lundy Island pier built?
In what decade was the Portishead pier closed?

context: Until the 1960s <a0_0>the piers at <b4_0>Weston-super-Mare<b4_0/>, Clevedon, Portishead and Minehead were served by the paddle steamers of P and A Campbell<a0_0/> who ran regular services to Barry and <b6_0>Cardiff<b6_0/> as well as Ilfracombe and Lundy Island. <a1_0>The pier at Burnham-on-Sea was used for <b5_0>commercial goods<b5_0/><a1_0/>, one of the reasons for the Somerset and Dorset Joint Railway was to provide a link between the Bristol Channel and the English Channel. <a2_0>The pier at Burnham-on-Sea is the shortest pier in the UK<a2_0/>. <a3_0>In the <b7_0><b8_0>1970s<b8_0/><b7_0/> the Royal Portbury Dock was constructed to provide extra capacity for the Port of Bristol<a3_0/>.
